content: The Dam Safety and Security Act of 2002, also known as the National Dam Safety Program Act, includes an amendment regarding an interagency committee on dam safety. The Dam Safety and Security Act of 2002, also known as the National Dam Safety Program Act, includes an amendment to establish an interagency committee on dam safety to coordinate and exchange information among Federal agencies regarding the implementation of Federal Guidelines for Dam Safety. The Dam Safety and Security Act of 2002 amended Section 8 to change the implementation plan to a strategic plan and update duties to improve dam safety in the United States. The Dam Safety and Security Act of 2002 amended Section 8 to establish goals, priorities, and target dates for improving dam safety in the United States, as well as to provide cooperation and assistance to interested governmental entities in all States. Additionally, the Act aims to develop technical assistance materials, seminars, and guidelines to enhance security for dams in the United States. The Dam Safety and Security Act of 2002 aims to improve dam safety in the United States by developing technical assistance materials, seminars, and guidelines to enhance security for dams. It also includes provisions for coordinating national efforts to improve dam safety. The Dam Safety and Security Act of 2002 aims to enhance dam safety in the United States by providing technical assistance and training programs. Amendments are made to Section 8 to improve the implementation plan and state dam safety programs. Amendments to Section 8 of the Dam Safety and Security Act of 2002 include providing assistance to States for establishing, maintaining, and improving dam safety programs in accordance with specified criteria. Amendments to Section 8 of the Dam Safety and Security Act of 2002 involve removing certain eligibility criteria for state assistance and changing references from "contract" to "agreement". The establishment of a Board is also addressed in the amendments. In paragraph (3), "contract" is replaced with "agreement". The Board establishment is modified to monitor dam safety in the US and advise on national policy. The Board is modified to monitor dam safety and advise on national policy. Voting membership is amended to include 11 voting members, with 5 selected from State dam safety officials and 1 selected by the Director. The Director selects 5 members from State dam safety officials and 1 member from the private sector. Nonvoting membership may include a representative from the National Laboratories. The Board, in consultation with the Director, may invite nonvoting members such as representatives from Federal or State agencies and dam safety experts to participate in meetings. The Board's duties include promoting effective dam safety programs nationwide and facilitating coordination and information exchange among agencies. The Board promotes effective dam safety programs nationwide and encourages coordination among Federal and State agencies for dam safety. Work groups may be established to assist in achieving these goals. The Director may establish work groups under the Board to assist in accomplishing its goals. Work groups consist of Board members and other selected individuals. Travel expenses for Board members representing Federal agencies are covered if funds are available. Each member of the Board representing a Federal agency will be reimbursed for travel expenses, including per diem, while performing services for the Board. Members representing State agencies may also be reimbursed if funds are available. Each member of the Board, whether representing a State agency, the private sector, or a work group, will be reimbursed for travel expenses by FEMA, including per diem, while away from home on Board-related duties. SEC. 4. RESEARCH. Section 9(a) (33 U.S.C. 467g) is amended to include cooperation with the Board, support for development, maintenance of information resources systems for dam safety management, and initiatives for effective public guidance. The amendment to Section 9(a) includes cooperation with the Board, support for information systems for dam safety management, and initiatives for effective public guidance. SEC. 5. DAM SAFETY TRAINING. The Act is amended to provide training for State dam safety staff and inspectors upon request from States with or developing a State dam safety program. SEC. 6. REPORTS. Section 11 is amended by removing subsection (a) and following text. SEC. 7. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Section 13(a)(1) is amended to increase annual amounts to $6,000,000 for fiscal years 2003 through 2006. Section 13(a)(2) is also amended to reallocate funds accordingly. In section 13, amendments are made to increase annual amounts for fiscal years 2003 through 2006. Section 13 is further amended to authorize appropriations for research and dam safety training. In section 13, amendments increase annual amounts for fiscal years 2003 through 2006 and authorize appropriations for research and dam safety training. Additionally, funds are allocated for dam safety training, staff employment, and carrying out specific sections for each fiscal year from 2003 to 2006.
